newsitem.title: USA: US requests WTO mediation in India import dispute.
newsitem.headline: US requests WTO mediation in India import dispute.

text.p: The United States on Tuesday asked the World Trade Organization to mediate its dispute with India over quantitative restrictions on imports, according to the U.S. Trade Representative's office.

"India has maintained import restrictions imposed on BOP (balance of payments) grounds for decades," the USTR statement said. "However, under the current circumstances, India no longer meets WTO criteria for use of WTO BOP provisions, thus the measures currently in place are no longer justified."
The WTO allows temporary measures such as import restrictions in cases of a "legitimate balance of payments crisis," the statement said.
Over the past two years, the United States and other WTO members have sought agreement with India over the phase-out of Indian restrictions on more 2,700 consumer and agricultural products, it said.
Under WTO rules, a minimum 60-day consultation period is required before a formal request for a panel may be made.
"The United States hopes to use this consultation period to encourage India to put forward an acceptable phase-out plan," the USTR statement said.
